exercises.name: biceps pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull yourself up by bending your elbows, bringing your chest towards the bar.
Step:3 Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: body-up
instructions: Step:1 Start by placing your hands on a raised surface, such as a bench or parallel bars, with your palms facing down and fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground and your body straight.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides, until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bench hip extension
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back against the bench and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench for support.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and hamstrings, then lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: 3/4 sit-up
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight squatting row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding onto a sturdy object or suspension trainer with your arms extended.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
Step:3 From the squat position, pull your body up towards the object or suspension trainer, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight squatting row (with towel)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel in front of you with your palms facing down.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
Step:3 As you lower into the squat, simultaneously pull the towel towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then slowly return to the starting position while extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight drop jump squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Jump up explosively, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:4 While in mid-air, quickly bring your feet together.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately drop back into a squat position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: biceps leg concentration curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your legs spread apart and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in one hand and place your elbow on the inside of your thigh, just above the knee.
Step:3 With your palm facing up, curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary.
Step:4 Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

exercises.name: biceps narrow pull-ups
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing towards you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull yourself up towards the bar, focusing on using your biceps to lift your body.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bench dip (knees bent)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge next to your hips.
Step:2 Slide your butt off the bench and straighten your legs in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground.
Step:3 Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bench pull-ups
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself under a bar or a sturdy horizontal surface that is at chest height.
Step:2 Grab the bar or surface with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:4 Pull your chest towards the bar or surface by squeezing your shoulder blades together and bending your elbows.
Step:5 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar or surface.
Step:6 Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bent knee lying twist (male)
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Extend your arms out to the sides, perpendicular to your body.
Step:3 Keeping your knees together, slowly lower them to one side, aiming to touch the ground with your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then engage your core and slowly lift your knees back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement to the other side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bear crawl
instructions: Step:1 Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
Step:2 Lift your knees slightly off the ground, keeping your back flat and your core engaged.
Step:3 Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot.
Step:4 Continue crawling forward, alternating your hand and foot movements.
Step:5 Maintain a steady pace and keep your core tight throughout the exercise.
Step:6 Continue for the desired distance or time.

exercises.name: bench dip on floor
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Slide your butt off the bench, supporting your weight with your hands.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell wrist curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
Step:2 Allow the barbell to roll down to your fingertips, keeping your wrists straight.
Step:3 Slowly curl the barbell up towards your forearms by flexing your wrists.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: battling ropes
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold one end of the rope in each hand, with your palms facing each other.
Step:3 Raise your arms to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Step:4 Begin making alternating waves with the ropes by rapidly raising and lowering each arm.
Step:5 Continue for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell wide reverse grip bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with a wide reverse grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
Step:4 Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in and your wrists straight.
Step:5 Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest, then push it back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell wrist curl v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
Step:4 Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your forearms.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: behind head chest stretch
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Interlace your fingers behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Slowly squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your chest forward.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
Step:5 Release the stretch and repeat as desired.

exercises.name: barbell zercher squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
Step:2 Hold the barbell in the crooks of your elbows, with your hands gripping the bar for stability.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest lifted as you lower your hips back and down into a squat position.
Step:4 Keep your knees in line with your toes and your weight in your heels.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell wide squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
Step:2 Hold the barbell across your upper back, resting it on your traps or rear delts.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower your body down into a squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Step:4 Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: basic toe touch (male)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Reach down towards your toes with your hands, keeping your legs as straight as possible.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell thruster
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Lower into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 As you reach the bottom of the squat, explosively drive through your heels to stand up, simultaneously pressing the barbell overhead.
Step:4 Lower the barbell back to shoulder height as you lower back into the squat position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight kneeling triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Kneel down on the ground with your knees hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your hands on the ground in front of you, shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step:3 Extend your legs straight behind you, balancing on your toes and hands, forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step:4 Bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight incline side plank
instructions: Step:1 Start by lying on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other.
Step:2 Place your forearm on the ground directly below your shoulder, with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from your head to your feet.
Step:4 Hold this position for the desired amount of time.
Step:5 Lower your hips back down to the ground and repeat on the other side.

exercises.name: barbell wide-grip upright row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang in front of your thighs, arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, exhale and lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell upright row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang in front of your thighs, arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight and core engaged, exhale and lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell sumo deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards.
Step:2 Place a barbell on the ground in front of you, centered between your feet.
Step:3 Bend your knees and lower your hips, keeping your back straight and chest up, to grip the barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:4 Engage your core and drive through your heels to lift the barbell off the ground, extending your hips and knees simultaneously.
Step:5 As you lift, keep your chest up and back straight, and push your hips forward to fully engage your glutes.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell upright row v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang in front of your thighs, arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, exhale and lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell straight leg deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend at your hips and lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:4 Lower the barbell until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Step:5 Engage your hamstrings and glutes to lift the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing wide grip biceps curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and your elbows close to your torso.
Step:3 Exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell step-up
instructions: Step:1 Stand in front of a bench or step with a barbell resting on your upper back.
Step:2 Place one foot on the bench or step, ensuring your entire foot is in contact with the surface.
Step:3 Push through your heel and step up onto the bench or step, fully extending your hip and knee.
Step:4 Pause briefly at the top, then lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the opposite leg.
Step:6 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing twist
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in front of your chest with both hands, palms facing down.
Step:2 Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
Step:3 Slowly twist your torso to the right, pivoting on your feet and hips, while keeping your lower body stable.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the end of the twist, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the twist to the left side.
Step:6 Continue alternating twists for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing wide-grip curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang at arm's length in front of your thighs, with your palms facing away from your body.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell upward by contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing wide military press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step:2 Lift the barbell to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly in front of the bar.
Step:3 Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully.
Step:4 Lower the barbell back to shoulder height and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing reverse grip curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
Step:2 Keep your elbows close to your torso and your upper arms stationary.
Step:3 Exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps, bringing the barbell as close to your shoulders as possible.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing rocking leg calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, balancing on the balls of your feet.
Step:3 Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing overhead triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Raise the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms close to your head, slowly lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then raise the barbell back to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell split squat v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Take a large step forward with your right foot, keeping your torso upright.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your knees and hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with your left leg forward for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell squat (on knees)
instructions: Step:1 Start by kneeling on the ground with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Step:2 Place a barbell across your shoulders, gripping it with an overhand grip and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest lifted as you slowly lower your body down by bending your knees, keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing back wrist curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Rest the barbell on the back of your hands with your palms facing down and your fingers pointing towards your body.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell squat jump step rear lunge
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Explode upwards, jumping off the ground as high as you can.
Step:4 Land softly on your feet and immediately step back with one leg into a reverse lunge.
Step:5 Lower your body down until your front thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight.
Step:6 Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat the jump and lunge sequence on the other leg.
Step:8 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell speed squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Step:2 Hold the barbell across your upper back, resting it on your traps or rear delts.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower your hips back and down, as if sitting into a chair.
Step:4 Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Drive through your heels to stand back up, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing concentration curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in one hand, palm facing up.
Step:2 Rest your opposite hand on your thigh for support.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the weight up towards your shoulder.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

exercises.name: barbell standing ab rollerout
instructions: Step:1 Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Step:2 Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell down towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your arms extended.
Step:3 Continue rolling the barbell forward until your body is fully extended and your hands are directly above your head.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then slowly roll the barbell back towards your thighs, maintaining control and keeping your core engaged.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing bradford press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell in front of your shoulders with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Press the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step:3 Lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing leg calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using your calves.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing front raise over head
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step:3 Slowly raise the barbell in front of you, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down.
Step:4 Continue lifting until the barbell is slightly above shoulder level.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing close grip military press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly closer than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lift the barbell to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:3 Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully.
Step:4 Lower the barbell back to shoulder height.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using only your toes.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: bodyweight side lying biceps curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your side with your legs extended and your head supported by your arm.
Step:2 Hold your upper arm against your side and bend your elbow to curl your forearm towards your shoulder.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your forearm back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell standing close grip curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, hands close together.
Step:2 Keep your elbows close to your torso and your upper arms stationary throughout the movement.
Step:3 Exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the bar until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale as you slowly begin to bring the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell sitted alternate leg raise (female)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and hold a barbell across your thighs.
Step:2 Place your hands on the sides of the bench for support.
Step:3 Keeping your legs straight, lift one leg up as high as possible while keeping it parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Lower the leg back down and repeat with the other leg.
Step:5 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell sitted alternate leg raise
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and hold a barbell across your thighs.
Step:2 Keeping your legs straight, lift one leg up as high as possible while keeping the other leg on the ground.
Step:3 Lower the raised leg back down and repeat with the other leg.
Step:4 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell wide bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
Step:4 Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out.
Step:5 Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest, then push it back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell side split squat v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
Step:2 Hold a barbell across your upper back, resting it on your shoulders.
Step:3 Take a big step to the side with your right foot, keeping your left foot planted.
Step:4 Bend your right knee and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
Step:5 Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat on the other side, stepping out with your left foot.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell single leg deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot slightly off the ground.
Step:3 Hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your right leg extended behind you for balance.
Step:4 Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping it close to your body and your left leg slightly bent.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift your torso back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

exercises.name: barbell single leg split squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Take a large step forward with one leg, keeping your torso upright.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your front knee and hip, while keeping your back leg straight.
Step:4 Continue lowering until your front thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

exercises.name: barbell seated twist
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with both hands in front of your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Step:3 Engage your core and slowly twist your torso to one side, keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the end of the twist, then slowly rotate back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the twist to the other side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated overhead triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and raise it overhead.
Step:3 Lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms close to your head.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then extend your arms to raise the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell upright row v. 3
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang in front of your thighs, arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your core engaged and back straight, exhale as you lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated overhead press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell off the rack and bring it to shoulder level, with your elbows bent and palms facing forward.
Step:4 Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms fully.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to shoulder level.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated close-grip concentration curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Rest your upper arms against your inner thighs, just above your knees, and let the barbell hang down in front of you.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a barbell resting on your thighs.
Step:2 Place the balls of your feet on a raised platform, such as a block or step.
Step:3 Lower your heels as far as possible, feeling a stretch in your calves.
Step:4 Raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calves.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated good morning
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and a barbell resting on your upper back.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and your chest up.
Step:3 Slowly hinge forward at the hips, lowering your torso towards the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a barbell resting on your thighs.
Step:2 Place the balls of your feet on a raised platform, such as a block or step.
Step:3 Position the barbell across your thighs and hold it securely with your hands.
Step:4 Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift your heels off the ground by extending your ankles.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated close grip behind neck triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with a close grip behind your neck, palms facing forward.
Step:3 Keep your elbows close to your head and slowly lower the barbell towards the back of your head.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then extend your arms back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell romanian deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:4 Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping it close to your body.
Step:5 Feel the stretch in your hamstrings as you lower the barbell.
Step:6 Once you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, push your hips forward and stand up straight.
Step:7 Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.
Step:8 Lower the barbell back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated behind head military press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell off the rack and bring it down to shoulder level, behind your head.
Step:4 Press the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended.
Step:5 Lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rollerout
instructions: Step:1 Kneel on the floor and hold a barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Roll the barbell forward, extending your arms and keeping your core engaged.
Step:3 Continue rolling forward until your body is fully extended and your arms are overhead.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then slowly roll the barbell back towards your knees, maintaining control.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell seated bradford rocky press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent and pointing forward.
Step:4 Press the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step:5 Lower the barbell back to shoulder height and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse wrist curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:2 Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
Step:3 Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your body.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rollerout from bench
instructions: Step:1 Start by kneeling on the floor with a barbell placed on a bench in front of you.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your arms in front of you.
Step:4 Continue rolling the barbell forward until your body is fully extended and your arms are overhead.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the fully extended position, then slowly roll the barbell back towards your body, returning to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse grip skullcrusher
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head at the end of the bench.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with a reverse grip, palms facing towards your face, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Extend your arms straight up over your chest, keeping your elbows in and your wrists straight.
Step:4 Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then extend your arms back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a preacher bench with your chest against the pad and your arms extended straight down, holding a barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell upward while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:2 Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the barbell upward, contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale as you slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse grip bent over row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse grip incline bench press
instructions: Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Step:3 Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
Step:5 Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
Step:6 Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse grip decline bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell reverse close-grip bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with a reverse grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
Step:4 Slowly lower the barbell down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:5 Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest.
Step:6 Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rear lunge v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Take a step backward with your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot.
Step:3 Bend both knees to lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the other leg.

exercises.name: barbell rear lunge
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back.
Step:2 Take a step backward with your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot.
Step:3 Bend both knees to lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the other leg.

exercises.name: barbell revers wrist curl v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
Step:4 Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upward as far as possible.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rear delt raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Raise the barbell out to the sides, keeping your arms straight, until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rear delt row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step:4 Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell pendlay row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
Step:3 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Pull the barbell towards your upper abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell rack pull
instructions: Step:1 Set up a barbell on a rack at knee height.
Step:2 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
Step:3 Bend at the hips and knees to lower yourself down and grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Engage your core and lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees, pulling your shoulders back and squeezing your glutes at the top.
Step:5 Lower the barbell back down to the starting position by bending at the hips and knees.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell pin presses
instructions: Step:1 Set up a barbell on a power rack at chest height.
Step:2 Stand facing the barbell and position yourself underneath it, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest, with your arms fully extended.
Step:5 Lower the barbell down towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
Step:6 Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
Step:7 Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell palms up wrist curl over a bench
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
Step:2 Rest your forearms on the bench, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
Step:3 Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the pad and your chest against the support.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell pullover
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your head at one end and your feet on the floor.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with a shoulder-width grip and extend your arms straight above your chest.
Step:3 Keeping your arms straight, lower the barbell behind your head in a controlled manner until you feel a stretch in your lats.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then raise the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell side bent v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with both hands, palms facing down.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise.
Step:3 Slowly bend your torso to the right side, lowering the barbell towards your right knee.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat the movement on the left side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell lying back of the head tricep extension
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your head at the end of the bench.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms straight up over your chest.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then extend your arms back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell overhead squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with a wide grip, positioning it overhead with your arms fully extended.
Step:3 Engage your core and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell one leg squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Lift one foot off the ground and extend it forward, keeping it parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Bend your standing leg and lower your body down as if sitting back into a chair, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
Step:4 Lower yourself until your thigh is parallel to the ground, then push through your heel to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.

exercises.name: barbell jm bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body.
Step:4 Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell prone incline curl
instructions: Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Lie face down on the bench with your chest and stomach resting against it.
Step:3 Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Extend your arms fully, allowing the barbell to hang down towards the floor.
Step:5 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:6 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Step:7 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:8 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:9 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercises.name: barbell one arm side deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Bend at the hips and lower the barbell towards the outside of your leg, keeping your arm straight and your chest up.
Step:4 Lower the barbell as far as you can while maintaining good form.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

exercises.name: barbell lateral lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back.
Step:2 Take a big step to the side with your right foot, keeping your left foot planted.
Step:3 Bend your right knee and lower your body down into a lunge position, keeping your left leg straight.
Step:4 Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side, stepping with your left foot.

exercises.name: barbell press sit-up
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back on a mat with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, resting it on your chest.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
